sen.j: 尚侍(ないしのかみ)とは、下記のとおりである。
sen.e: Naishi no kami indicates as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文に「下記のとおりである」を追加indicates as follows を追加
sen.e: Naishi no kami indicates as follows.

sen.j: 1 明治・大正時代の、宮中女官の最高の官名。
sen.e: 1. the highest government post for the court lady during the Meiji and Taisho periods,
1. the highest government post for the court lady during the Meiji and Taisho periods.
sen.cmt: カンマをピリオドに変更
sen.e: 1. the highest government post for the court lady during the Meiji and Taisho periods.

sen.j: 2 平安時代の、内侍司の長官を勤めた女官の官名。
sen.e: 2. the government post for the court lady who served as Kami of Naishinotsukasa.
2. the government post for the court lady who served as Kami (director) of Naishi no tsukasa.
2. the government post for the court lady who served as Kami (director) of Naishi no tsukasa.

sen.j: 天皇に近侍して、奏請・伝宣などをつかさどる。
sen.e: Naishinokami attended on the emperor, being in charge of conveying messages from retainers to the emperor and the orders from the emperor to retainers.
Naishi no kami attended on the emperor, being in charge of conveying messages from retainers to the emperor and the orders from the emperor to retainers.
Naishi no kami attended on the emperor, being in charge of conveying messages from retainers to the emperor and the orders from the emperor to retainers.

sen.j: 後に女御･更衣に準じて後宮に列する。
sen.e: Later, Naishinokami was ranked with Nyogo and Koui in the women's quarters in the Imperial Palace.
Later, Naishi no kami was ranked with Nyogo and Koui in the women's quarters in the Imperial Palace.
Later, Naishi no kami was ranked with Nyogo and Koui in the women's quarters in the Imperial Palace.
